chargeHist.descr: Possess cocaine w/Intent to deliver as repeater  (>40g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorian C. BROWN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for twelve (12) months, under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.
$518.00 court costs imposed.  Cash bail to be applied.  
The defendant is given credit for 127 days.  (03-15-14 to 07-10-14)
Attorney Reetz informs the court that the remainder of the cash bail is to be sent directly to him for payment of his fees.  He will disburse the balance to the defendants mother.  The Court indicates that Attorney Reetz will have to supply signed documentation from the parties that furnished the cash bail that this is their agreement.  He will do so.
